result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly R Johnston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation to be terminated on 4-5-17 with no unpaid financial obligations
Copy of obituary received.
for furlough filed by defendant -by fax

Defendant Kimberly R Johnston in court, in custody, pro se, by video.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin, stated good time not available for conditional jail time. Court addressed defendant. Jail credit not applicable to conditional jail time. Both motions denied.  Defendant motioned for 24 hour furlough to attend funeral, defendant unsure of date, was set for then. Information to be provided to the Court.
Motion hearing on January 5, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Motion for Goodtime filed by defendant.
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - conviction DNA on file
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Motion for Preservation of Evidence filed by attorney Amanda Riek
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Kimberly R Johnston in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is an argued plea/sentencing.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentencing recommendations given with argument by State and Defense.  Defendant made statement.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation include 20 days in jail, with Huber.  $443.00 costs.  Bond on hand to be applied towards costs, remaining balance to be returned.  Jail start date to be determined by agent, must be within the 1 year.  2 days credit.  Submit DNA sample.  11:14/12:18
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek, requesting the jury trial be removed from calendar and an argued plea/sentencing hearing be set.
